page.title: 04Housing in Dale
page.content: The main streets of Dale village form a rectangle.Most of the houses are situated on the North and South sides of this.The sea is close to the Eastern side and the houses in this part of the village are at least 100 years old,built with thick stone walls and small windows.Most are cement rendered and colour washed.They were originally owned by the Dale Castle Estate,but some have been sold.Further away from the sea,the roads are lined with newer houses:council bungalows and houses;terraced and semi-detached houses built about 1956 as married quarters for the R.N.Air Station at Kete.Of the 115 houses in Dale,36 are holiday homes.Outside the village,most houses are traditional farm-houses. {Dale Castle},the largest house,is privately occupied.
